virtualContributorSpaceSettings.name: Name
virtualContributorSpaceSettings.placeholder: This $t(common.virtualContributor) is based on its own curated $t(common.collection) of documents, text, and links.
virtualContributorSpaceSettings.infoTextBoK: Select the $t(common.subspace) you want as a body of knowledge for this $t(common.virtualContributor)
virtualContributorSpaceSettings.noSubspacesInfo: Create a $t(common.subspace) first, and populate it with the relevant information for your $t(common.virtualContributor).

confirmDeletion.description: Do you want to delete this {{entity}}? This action is irreversible. All $t(common.profile) information will be removed and people will no longer be able to interact with the {{entity}}

createVirtualContributorWizard.noSpaces: Couldn't find any $t(common.space) hosted by you, please contact us for support.

initial.title: Create a $t(common.virtualContributor)
initial.profileDescription: Choose a name and avatar now, or personalize your $t(common.profile) later on the VC $t(common.Profile) page.
initial.description: A $t(common.virtualContributor) allows you to interact with AI on Alkemio. What do you want to make available through your $t(common.virtualContributor)?
initial.useExistingSpace: The content of a $t(common.spaceSubspace) on Alkemio

loadingInfo.vcSpaceCreation: A $t(common.space) for interaction with your $t(common.virtualContributor) is being built. This process may take a few moments to complete.

cancel.title: Discard $t(common.virtualContributor)
cancel.description: Are you sure you want to stop creating your $t(common.virtualContributor)? Your work will not be saved.

addContent.title: Add knowledge
addContent.description: What knowledge do you want your $t(common.virtualContributor) to have? Write it down in $t(common.posts) or upload it in documents.
addContent.descriptionBold: You can update, add, and remove content later.

post.title: $t(common.post) title
post.exampleDescription: Tip: Create a structured and specific text, for example: Background Alkemio, founded in 2020, was born out of frustration with slow progress on COVID-related challenges and a recognition of the numerous fast-moving challenges we face daily. Governance To maintain trust and realize our long-term vision, we‚Äôve adopted Steward Ownership as our core group structure. Steward ownership is...
post.tooltip: More $t(common.posts) can be added in the Body of Knowledge once the VC is created

documents.tooltip: Supported file formats: Text on websites, .pdf, .doc(x), .xls(x). Maximum file size: 20mb

addContent.submitDisabled: Add at least one $t(common.post) to continue

create.title: Create $t(common.virtualContributor) with an External AI
create.subTitle: Choose a provider and enter your API Key or token to connect your external AI to a $t(common.virtualContributor)

provider.title: Provider
provider.placeholder: Select a provider from this list

comingSoon.title: üöÄ Coming soon!
comingSoon.subTitle: We're currently building the functionality to use external AI services for your Virtual Contributor. You can help us by sharing which AI service you would like to use.

input.label: AI Service
input.placeholder: E.g. the AI that xx created to xx

contactOptions.title: May we contact you if we have questions about the way you want to use this AI service?

trySection.title: üéâ Try it out!
trySection.subTitle: To start interacting, simply type @{{vcName}} in a $t(common.comment). Give it a try in the preview below.
trySection.postDescription: At Alkemio, we utilize $t(common.posts) to facilitate collaborative interactions with AI. Unlike private chats, other $t(common.members) within a $t(common.space) can learn from and contribute to these interactions. Similar to mentioning a human contributor, you can use the ‚Äò@‚Äô symbol followed by the $t(common.virtualContributor)‚Äôs name.

tryInfoSection.title: üëçThat‚Äôs it!
tryInfoSection.description:
Your $t(common.virtualContributor) is ready! To start interacting, invite the $t(common.virtualContributor) to a $t(common.space) and once it‚Äôs a $t(common.member), simply type @{{vcName}} in a $t(common.comment).

Enjoy!

existingSpace.title: Choose a $t(common.spaceSubspace)
existingSpace.description: Which $t(common.space) or $t(common.subspace) do you want to bring to life with the $t(common.virtualContributor)? Below you'll be able to choose from all $t(common.spaces) and $t(common.subspaces) that you are $t(common.host) of.
existingSpace.label: $t(common.spaceSubspace)
existingSpace.noSpaces: You need to be an $t(common.admin) of a $t(common.space) to proceed with this option. To create a $t(common.virtualContributor) without a $t(common.space), please go back and follow the Written Knowledge flow.

chooseCommunity.title: Hello, {{vcName}}!
chooseCommunity.description: Your $t(common.virtualContributor) is ready! To start interacting, your $t(common.virtualContributor) should be added to a $t(common.space). Select one below, or continue without. In that case you will have to add the VC manually through the $t(common.community) tab of a $t(common.space).
chooseCommunity.label: Space

confirm.title: Continue without $t(common.space) $t(common.membership)
confirm.description: A $t(common.virtualContributor) can only interact within a $t(common.space). Are you sure you want to proceed without adding them to a $t(common.space)? You can still invite the $t(common.virtualContributor) later through the $t(common.space)‚Äôs $t(common.community) tab.
